column5: The day started like any other day this week â€¦ COLD AS HELL  Drive down too the Oakville Go, Met up with Bitsmith2k and the trip was on.  Arrived at Fishmasters at 7am on the dot,  first thought was this ain't no cooks bay.  Parking was about 500feet from the ice.. Ahhh when your pulling your pack this was half the distance you walk just too get parking at cooks  So meet Steve (fishmaster) got some tips bait and we headed out with high hopes.   After unpacking and setting up in the cold we started to fish, We were marking tones of fish some big some small.  There were a few hook ups but nothing lasting longer than a few seconds.. I call it a learning experience.  But!  did catch this beauty, and no it was not on there when I put it down      Over all a great day on the lower grand with cold gusty winds the moved my hut with me in it   but the great company and learning made it well worth the effort.  Thanks Lexx

That looks like a foul hooked fish!!!... hope it went back down the hole and you and Smitty didn't gorge yourselves on it for a shore lunch eh!!!  Real nice report and pics Lex!!!  You'll get their little   -es next time Bubba!!!
Way to go, Paul!  Hey, are you gonna be at the Tyler Tourney?
Glad to here you guys survived.  Hopefully the next time it's warmer and you can convince the right fish to bite
Great report and pics Lex  The best part is you got out fishing with good company..... that's what counts Wish you bigger ones next time Thanks for sharing Leechman

the curse of the grand lives on for me  we'll have to do it again, hopefully with better results and less wind.. i've never had wind lift up the hut with me in it before, that was pretty cool..  anyway was a good time fishin with ya paul..
absolutly, me and the entire herd will be there
Great report, i think you did an awesome job catching that smelt......i fish a lake that has swarms of 'em...cant catch one for love or money!
